titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: It is now a general saying in Russia that a Communist is known not only by his leather jacket and spurs, not even only by his unendurable bullying attitude, but, above all, by his soured and embittered temper. "As suspicious as a Communist" is the common expression.
v. Bolshevist Russia by Anton Karlgren, p. 237

body.p: Pattinson, an ex–chorister of the Cathedral, came to see me about his Ordination at Trinity.
I lent Guadalla's [sic] "Palmerston" to old Dr McCullagh.
